title: fathafraink
author: fathafraink
content: What is Bitcoin Faucet ?A Bitcoin Faucet in market language is like a water carrier giving out free Bitcoins. So, in essence, you can get Bitcoin without having to buy or pay. The method is easy, all you have to do is visit the Bitcoin faucet website or application, then you have to do a number of small tasks to get the Bitcoin.For example, you might be asked to do a captcha, your job is to just fill in or answer the code that appears on the screen so you can verify it. There are also faucets that give simple questions, for example about Bitcoin or cryptocurrencies. The answer is usually easy, you don't have to be a genius.After you finish doing the task, you will get a small amount of Bitcoin as a reward. But don't expect too much, usually the value is small. Bitcoin Faucets are more for just experimenting or for honing your experience with Bitcoin. So, if you want to try to have Bitcoin without having to spend a lot of money, faucets can be a good choice.Just remember, this Bitcoin faucet is only for getting a small amount of Bitcoin. So, if you want to earn lots of Bitcoins, you should probably try other methods, like trading or mining.Here are two legend sites that provide bitcoin faucets 1. FreeBitco.inFreeBitco.in is an interesting application because users will get free Bitcoins per hour, and you can't cheat by using multiple accounts, because it's limited to only one user on one IP. This site is legend, because it's existed a few years ago and this forum already make a discussion about it.2. FreeBitcoin.ioPlease note, at FreeBitcoin.io Bitcoin can only be withdrawn if your assets have reached 1 Bitcoin. The rewards will also be sent directly to your bitcoin e-wallet!I hope seniors who know more about legit bitcoin faucet sites, please tell us all so that we also have more experience as beginners, and also so that we have informative discussions here.Note : Just remember, this Bitcoin faucet is only for getting a small amount of Bitcoin. So, if you want to earn lots of Bitcoins, you should probably try other methods, like trading or mining.

comments.author: Ultegra134
comments.body: The era of faucets has passed; they used to be a great starting point for newbies to collect some petty, in terms of value, amounts of BTC in order to introduce them to Bitcoin. However, most faucets have stopped operating, and those that still do are paying a mere amount of satoshis that can be counted with the fingers of your one hand. It's not worth your time; it never was, but at least in the past, you could easily accumulate a relatively decent sum of Bitcoin.Captchas and microtasking such as PTC advertisements or faucets are a complete waste of time. There's also a decent chance that you'll never reach the minimum payout, and even if we suppose that you do, you'll lose most of your earnings to transaction fees.
